subhead: The tightening of criteria for residency in France has led to a 42% drop in the amount of permits given out over the first nine months of the year.

title: For the future French aircraft carrier, Macron announces new ship 'in an era of predators'
subhead: Emmanuel Macron has confirmed the construction of a replacement for the 'Charles-de-Gaulle' aircraft carrier, set to enter service in 2038. With a crew of 2,000 sailors, the new ship will be able to carry 30 fighter jets, several types of aerial drones and numerous electronic warfare systems.

title: Is the Thanksgiving turkey a Democrat?
subhead: 'My Christmas under Trump' (1/5). French journalist Georgia Husson moved to New York as the city geared up for the winter holidays. She recounts the Friendsgiving hosted by a group of friends in Connecticut, where political opinions clashed.
byline: By Georgia Husson (New York, special correspondent)

title: Six Louvre masterpieces we're glad weren't stolen in the heist
subhead: Following the dramatic October theft at the world's largest museum, Le Monde in English journalists reflected on our favorite objects housed in the Paris institution.

title: Trump and the 'derangement syndrome' driving people crazy
subhead: To discredit the president's opponents, the Make America Great Again movement has coined the phrase 'Trump derangement syndrome': a supposed mental illness that explains their systematic opposition. While the psychiatric argument for this has not been proven, many Democrats attest to the anger they feel every time the president speaks.

title: Madagascar's metalheads lead charge of anger: 'It's easier to make yourself heard when you scream'
subhead: After three weeks of protest, Madagascar's Generation Z succeeded in toppling those in power on October 14. The uprising drew much of its strength from countercultural circles, chief among them the island's vibrant metal scene. Heirs to a long tradition, Madagascar's metalheads condemn poverty, inequality and the regime's incompetence.
byline: By Jean-Philippe Rémy (Antananarivo, Madagascar, special correspondent)

title: Giorgia Meloni: Neo-fascist or far right? Why Italian PM's tenure raises questions among political experts
subhead: The Italian prime minister has been in power now for three years. Italy's political experts question the normalization of this leader, who comes from a neo-fascist background. Has her tenure really been accompanied by a moderation of her political views?
